1 (function($NS){
  2 	
  3 	var slice = Array.prototype.slice,
  4 	    utils = $NS.patternUtils,
  5 		isFunction = utils.isFunction,
  6 		isObject = utils.isObject;
  7 	
  8 	/**
  9 	 * Observable class should be used as Mixin when creating objects
 10 	 * with properties we would like to observe when they are changed.
 11 	 * @class 
 12 	 * @name py.Observable
 13 	 * @constructor
 14 	 */
 15 	$NS.Class('Observable', {
 16 		
 17 		__observers: {},
 18 		
 19 		/**
 20 		 * Function triggers all observers assigned to single property.
 21 		 * @function
 22 		 * @name py.Observable#triggerObserers
 23          * @param {String} property for which we would like to trigger observers
 24 		 */
 25 		triggerObservers: function(property){
 26             var self = this,
 27                 observers = self.__observers[property],
 28                 i=0,
 29                 l;
 30             
 31             if(observers){
 32                 for(i=0, l=observers.length; i<l; i++){
 33                     observers[i].apply(self, arguments);
 34                 }
 35             }
 36         
 37         },
 38 		
 39 		/**
 40 		 * Function returns value of chosen property
 41 		 * 
 42 		 * @function
 43          * @name py.Observable#get
 44 		 * 
 45          * @param {String} property name
 46          * @returns {Object} value of the property
 47 		 */
 48 		get: function(property){
 49 			return this[property];
 50 		},
 51 		
 52 		/**
 53 		 * Function sets property to provided value and 
 54 		 * triggers all observers assigned to observe this property.
 55 		 * 
 56 		 * @function
 57          * @name py.Observable#set
 58 		 * 
 59 		 * @example
 60 		 * var observableInstance = new py.Observable();
 61 		 * observableInstance.observe('price', function(propertyName, newValue, oldValue){
 62 		 *    //do some action 
 63 		 * })
 64 		 * 
 65 		 * observableInstance.set('price', 10);
 66 		 * 
 67 		 * //For this function you can pass map of key value pairs to be set
 68 		 * observableInstance.set({
 69 		 *    'price': 10,
 70 		 *    'size' : 20,
 71 		 *    'name' : 'box' 
 72 		 * });
 73 		 * 
 74          * @param {String} propertyName
 75          * @param {Object} value
 76 		 */
 77 		set: function(property, value){
 78 			var self = this,
 79 				oldValue;
 80 				
 81 			if(!utils.pairCall(self.set, arguments[0], self) && !isFunction(self[property])){
 82 			    oldValue = self[property];
 83                 self[property] = value;
 84                 self.triggerObservers(property, value, oldValue);
 85 			}
 86 			
 87 		},
 88 		
 89 		/**
 90 		 * Function works similar to 'set' but it is used to call
 91 		 * object functions and trigger observers assigned to called function.
 92 		 * Any additional parameter passed to this function will be used to 
 93 		 * call chosen object's method.
 94 		 * 
 95 		 * @example
 96 		 * py.Class('Point', { Mixin: py.Observable
 97 		 *     construct: function(x,y){
 98 		 *        this.x = x;
 99 		 *        this.y = y;
100 		 *     },
101 		 *     move: function(x,y){
102 		 *        this.set('x', this.x + x);
103 		 *        this.set('y', this.y + y);
104 		 *     }
105 		 * },'geometry')
106 		 * 
107 		 * var point = new geometry.Point(10,10);
108 		 * 
109 		 * point.observe('move',function(functionName, result, args){
110 		 *     //handle move observer
111 		 * });
112 		 * 
113 		 * point.callFunction('move', 3, 5);
114 		 * 
115 		 * @function
116 		 * @name py.Observable#callFunction
117 		 * 
118          * @param {String} functionName
119 		 */
120 		callFunction: function(functionName){
121 			var self = this,
122 				args = slice.call(arguments, 1),
123 				result;
124 			
125 			if(isFunction(self[functionName])){
126 				result = self[functionName].apply(self, args);
127 				self.triggerObservers(functionName, result, args);
128 				return result;
129 			}
130 		},
131 		
132 		/**
133 		 * Function adds observer to object's property or function.
134 		 * Observer function is called when property is changed or 
135 		 * observed function is being called (when using 'set' or 'callFunction'
136 		 * methods). Observer function is called with arguments as described in example.
137 		 * 
138 		 * @example
139 		 * 
140 		 * function propertyObserver(propertyName, newValue, oldValue){}
141 		 * 
142 		 * function functionObserver(functionName, result, arg1, arg2, arg3){}
143 		 * 
144 		 * @function
145 		 * @name py.Observable#observe
146 		 * 
147          * @param {String} propertyName or functionName
148          * @param {Function} observer function
149 		 */
150 		observe: function(property, observer){
151 			var self = this,
152 			    observers = self.__observers;
153 			
154 			if(!utils.pairCall(self.observe, arguments[0], self)){
155 			    if(!observers[property]){
156                     observers[property] = [];
157                 }
158                 
159                 if(isFunction(observer)){
160                     observers[property].push(observer); 
161                 }
162 			}    
163 			
164 			
165 		},
166 		
167 		/**
168 		 * Function removes previously added observer.
169 		 * 
170 		 * @function
171 		 * @name py.Observable#removeObserver
172 		 * 
173          * @param {String} propertyName or functionName
174          * @param {Function} observer previously added observer reference
175 		 */
176 		removeObserver: function(property, observer){
177 			var observers = this.__observers[property] || [],
178 			    i;
179 				
180             i = observers.length;
181             while(i--){
182                 if(observers[i] === observer){
183                     observers.splice(i,1);
184                     return;
185                 }
186             }
187 			
188 		},
189 		
190 		/**
191          * Function removes all observers from chosen property or function.
192          * 
193          * @function
194          * @name py.Observable#removeObservers
195          * 
196          * @param {String} propertyName or functionName
197          */
198 		removeObservers: function(property){
199 			var observers = this.__observers;
200 			if(observers[property]){
201 				delete observers[property];
202 			}    
203 	    }
204 	}, $NS);
205 	
206 	
207 }(patternity));
208
